abstracts.cdata!:
Sound design will diminish if not
            eliminate most of the potential adverse impacts of project
            activities associated with the Second National Solidarity
            Project for Afghanistan. Good engineering design will, in
            most cases, have a positive impact on the environmental
            conditions in the project area. Construction and operation
            stage impacts will be addressed through a simplified
            Environmental Management Plan. The environmental management
            plan will suggest measures such as those identified in this
            environmental and social management framework. This report
            instructs that the following guidelines be included in
            contractual agreements:  Install the work site in areas far
            enough from water points, houses and sensitive areas.
            Provide sanitary equipment and installations if needed
            appropriate. Establish site regulations for site management.
            Adhere strictly to laws, rules and other permits. Follow
            hygiene and set security on work sites. Protect neighboring
            properties. Prevent traffic congestion and ease access of
            nearby population during the work shift. Protect staff
            working on work sites. Avoid any wastewater discharge, oil
            spills, and discharge of any type of pollutants on soils, on
            surface waters or ground waters, in sewers, drainage
            ditches. Protect the environment (air quality) against
            exhaust fuels and oils. Protect the environment against dust
            and other solid residues. Install containers to collect
            wastes generated next to the areas of activity. Inform and
            raise the awareness of the populations before any activity
            causing degradation of natural vegetation and resources.
            Compensate beneficiaries before any work that would cause
            demolition of private properties. Use a quarry for materials
            according to the mining code requirements. Plant trees in
            case of deforestation or tree felling. Ban waste slashing
            and burning on site. Set speed limits for work site engines
            and cars. Allow the access of public and emergency services.
            Organize the storage of materials on the public highway.
            Control parking and displacements of machines. Provide
            footbridges and access of neighbors. Provide signaling of
            works. Respect cultural sites. Dispose of asbestos safely.
            Consider impacts such as noise, dust, and safety concerns on
            the surrounding population and schedule construction
            activities accordingly. Protect soil surfaces during
            construction and revegetate or physically stabilize eligible
            surfaces. Prevent standing water in open construction pits,
            quarries or fill areas to avoid potential contamination of
            the water table and the development of a habitat for
            disease-carrying vectors and insects. Select sustainable
            construction materials, particularly wood. Control and clean
            the construction site daily. During construction, control
            dust by using water or through other means. Provide adequate
            waste disposal and sanitation services at the construction
            site. Dispose of solid waste materials appropriately.
            Preserve natural habitats along streams, steep slopes, and
            ecologically sensitive areas; Develop maintenance and
            reclamation plans and restore vegetation.
